question: I had blood in my urine Dec 2006. I went to the doctor & it was determined to be a UTI. I was prescribed Cipro. I took it & it cleared up. Oct 2007, I had blood on my tissue after I urinated.  The blood only appeared within 2-3 days of my period. I went to the doctor, again. The doctor said that I did not have a UTI and said to see a Urologist. The day after I went to the doctor, the blood went away. My cycle started within 2 days, so I did not follow up with a Urologist. Last week, I noticed blood on my tissue!!  A few days later, I saw blood in my urine. I went to the doctor.  After another urinalysis, the doctor said that I did not have a UTI & that I really needed to seek the help of a Urologist.  Now I am concerned!! I need to see a Urologist but I do not have insurance!!  I don't know how much it will cost. Will they even see me w/o insurance? I am 28, 5" 11", and weigh 300 lbs.  My grandmother just died of pancreatic cancer due to complications with diabetes.  I have always been perfectly healthy.  I have never had any health problems other than STD's as a teenager.  I don't have a family history of any kidney diseases.  I don't have high blood pressure or any signs of diabetes.  My aunt is a nurse and she said I could just have kidney stones.  She is trying to assist me in not worrying.  But, I have a seven year old daughter that I have to live for!!  I can not have any medical problems this early in life!  I read that signs of progressed kidney cancer is blood in the urine!!  I know I need to go to the doctor and I would of been there ASAP if I had insurance!!  I applied for health insurance today but, I am afraid because of this episode, they won't cover any expenses following it.  I know I can't get an answer for what can be causing the bleeding but I do need some type of assistance!!  I need to know that this is common and that in most cases, it is not serious.  I NEED HELP!!Thanks,Scared for my Life!!
title: Blood in urine, not a UTI??
